channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Josh Dawsey, Tyler Pager & Isaac Arnsdorf, 2024
channel.desc: A behind-the-scenes account of the 2024 presidential election that sent Donald Trump back to the White House for a second, non-consecutive term - only the second president since Grover Cleveland to achieve that distinction.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Gregory Slayton, Portraits of Ukraine
channel.desc: Former diplomat Gregory Slayton talks about the history and culture of the people of Ukraine and how they have been coping since Russia's invasion in 2022.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Phil Gramm & Donald Boudreaux, the Triumph of Economic Freedom
channel.desc: Former senator Phil Gramm and economist Donald Boudreaux talk about the history of government involvement in the U.S. economy and argue that it has had an overall negative effect.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Josh Dawsey, Tyler Pager & Isaac Arnsdorf, 2024
channel.desc: A behind-the-scenes account of the 2024 presidential election that sent Donald Trump back to the White House for a second, non-consecutive term - only the second president since Grover Cleveland to achieve that distinction.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Carl Zimmer, Air-Borne - The Hidden History of the Life We Breathe
channel.desc: Carl Zimmer examines the microscopic organisms that live in the air we breathe; the Smithsonian Associates provided this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Thor Hanson, Close to Home - The Wonders of Nature Just Outside Your Door
channel.desc: Biologist Thor Hanson explains how nature exists not just in rural areas, but in cities and backyards. Town Hall Seattle hosted this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Rich Benjamin, Talk to Me
channel.desc: Cultural anthropologist Rich Benjamin talks about his grandfather, Daniel Fignol, the former president of Haiti who was ousted in a coup in 1957, and his family's reluctance to acknowledge what happened to him.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Karida Brown, the Battle for the Black Mind
channel.desc: Emory University professor Karida Brown, who studies racism and Black life, documents the history of educational freedom and justice among African Americans.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Finalists for the 2023 George Washington Book Prize discuss their books on the founding era.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Christopher Scalia, 13 Novels Conservatives Will Love but Probably Haven't Read
channel.desc: American Enterprise Institute senior fellow Christopher Scalia, a former English professor, recommends fiction titles that he says will resonate with conservatives; included are books by Samuel Johnson, Zora Neale Hurston and Nathaniel Hawthorne.

channel.title: Phil Gramm & Donald Boudreaux, the Triumph of Economic Freedom

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Texas Christian University professor Gene Allen Smith teaches a class about George Washington's character.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: American History TV
channel.desc: Airing weekends, "American History TV" offers programming about people and events that document the American story, geared toward history aficionados. Shows that air under the "American History TV" banner cover the history of the nation, from its founding in the 18th century through modern times. Topics covered include the Civil War, presidents and the exploration of historical sites.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: James Bradley, co-editor of the Martin Van Buren Papers, talks about his biography of our eighth president, the first in-depth look at his presidency in decades.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: A NASA documentary covers the April 12, 1981, launch of the first space shuttle, Columbia.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Unprecedented coverage of the U.S. semiquincentennial with live events, expert insights, and exclusive access to historic sites, documents, and reenactments-celebrating 250 years of American history and democracy.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This newsreel style film tours Washington, D.C. during World War II and describes how the city has changed with an influx of workers and government entities supporting the war effort.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: A look at the people and events that shaped the American Civil War and Reconstruction.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Civil War

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: America250 Chair Rosie Rios and state and local leaders in Pennsylvania outline plans for the 2026 semiquincentennial; they forecast the long-term civic, educational, economic, and cultural impact of the nation's 250th birthday celebration.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: America 250
channel.desc: Authors and historians talk about the military, political, and social history of the western frontier during the American Revolution.
